column3: I was booked on another flight and not compensated for anything.
Main Cabin select seemed worth the money at the time of booking (and the people in our original seats looked comfy).
Flight attendants were friendly and helpful despite grumbling from some passengers on the fully booked flights.
For best fares book early.
Hawaiian Air booked our flight since they don't fly to Philadelphia they did the leg LAX- PHL on Virgin America.
Additional costs you don't think of when booking your flight added $90 more dollars to my trip: Check baggage meal and a movie.
I will be booking on Virgin American for all possible future flights.
In SFO we booked baggage through Las Vegas on to Virgin Atlantic.
We booked 2 premium economy bulkhead seats (Virgin America markets its exit row and bulkhead economy seats as premium economy).
Allowed two checked bags as it was booked on the same ticket as my international flight on V Australia.
Snacks were of good quality and the meal I ordered was tasty but not excessively heavy.
All food and snacks cost money.
Flying in MCS gets you complimentary meals and non-alcoholic drinks and the meals offered are miles ahead of what any other U.S. carrier would offer.
Yes there is no free snacks but I brought food with me and ordered free drinks from the TV menu.
Possibly the worst cabin attendants I have ever experienced no communication skills almost threw the food at us were of no other assistance (even though we were in cabin select).
The ability to open a tab for meals snacks and entertainment selections make Virgin in a century beyond their domestic competitors.
The food was good
column4: although the salad (while good) was a bit small portion-wise.

column3: Although dessert was included as part of the meal service none was provided.
Moreover I was greatly disappointed by the lack of hot meals sold on board where small cold sandwiches and junk food consisting of crackers chips and cookies dominate the in flight menu.
Additional costs you don't think of when booking your flight added $90 more dollars to my trip: Check baggage meal and a movie.
They canceled my return flight from Canada and then acted as if they were doing me a monumental favor by not charging me to change my flight to one that was not canceled.
I was sending 3 people out to Los Angeles for a job and the flight from JFK was cancelled with no reason given.
In the end I was booked on a different flight than my boyfriend and had to cancel the trip after being told they couldn't do anything about the different flights!
The flight was cancelled after 4 hours.
I was told no refund but they would agree to waive the $100 cancellation fee.
it was a 7am flight and no other flights that day were cancelled.
Onboard they offered noise cancelling headphones.
Trip from IAD to SFO was canceled resulting in missing all connecting flights with a partner airline.
Not one person at JFK knew how to handle a cancelled flight!
A canceled flight is bad enough; incompetent handling afterwards is worse.
The flight was very affordable and was on time.

column3: We were not rebooked to another flight.
I was one of them as the 30 minute flight I needed to take was booked for 24 hours later with $7 per person meal credit for the entire 24 hours.
The pocket in fron of the seat was very low on the seat in front so that when I put my book in the pocket it bulged out so much that I had to keep my knees apart.
As a 1K I enjoy personalized attention with UA such as automatic rebooking on cancelled flights or missed connections.
I got re- booked on the flight for the next day at the same time was given a night at hotel and $14 voucher for the meal for the whole day.
So let me see

column4: there was no meal offered

column3: It's bad enough that the airline doesn't serve any food at no charge anymore but to top it off their in-flight service has got much worse.
I went immediately to the service counter to have it sorted out and they had already switched us to a Delta flight transferred our bags and arranged meal vouchers for us.
There was no food service on the Sacramento to Washington flight which is inexcusable on that long of a flight.

The plane we were on from London to NYC was just about clean enough my gluten free meal was gone because it's United (My flight had been cancelled and my meal with it) and the entertainment system was down because it's United.
Our little one got sick on the flight and there were no bags
column4: it looked like the plane had not even been properly cleaned before our delayed flight.

column4: delayed flights

column3: In fact 2 of the delayed flights were more than 2 hours delayed.
They have consistently delayed flights to/from MRY because they cannot find a plane.
The question of whether I was in for an adventure aka a delayed flight to a completely different location was condescending.
After waiting almost 4 hours at the airport with a toddler because of a delayed flight that's not how to really brighten someone's day and treat them.
I told the agent that it wasn't weather that it was an excessively delayed flight that caused me to miss my connecting flights.
I got caught in FRA with the merger mess on "the" day and since then it has been a series of canceled and long delayed flights with missed connections and very old and ragged aircraft.

Lost bags delayed flights lack of communication wrong allocation of seats (such as row 50 in an airline that only has 46 rows) and rude staff have made my collective experience with United Airlines a negative one.
They actually scanned our boarding passes in and had us lined up ready to get on the plane just to have us turn around and go back inside to later find out our flight would be cancelled.

column3: The first time I flew United I ended up sleeping in the airport when my flight was cancelled.

What I've learned - you pay double the price for United as opposed to other airlines for delays and cancellations due to "flight crew availability".

column5: causing us to lose a day of our vacation.

column3: What kind of business sense is that?

column5: boarded the flight from Dulles to Kuwait

column7: zero miles for the Dulles to Kuwait leg will be applied to passengers’ account as credit toward their annual status - seems unfair if United accepted the payment for the flight and we all boarded the flight.

column3: I swore I'd never fly United a couple of years ago this time I didn't notice the flight was operated by United.

What kind of business sense is that?

The last 6 United flights in the past year that I and my family have taken have all resulted in some form of delays lost luggage or rude staff.

column3: I booked a trip to fly from Houston to Lubbock with a stop in Austin.
The return flight home was overbooked and at 100%.
BWI to Islip my normal way to get there on Southwest is professional clean easy to book and I get an overall confident feeling that they all know what they are doing.
Add at least 2 hours to any trip you book with southwest.
From booking each flight to checking in and arrival they run rings around most other airlines in the USA and the EEC.
You may be waiting all day or even until the next day for another Southwest flight that isn't booked and is flying where you are going.
So now SWA will oversell the flight and reebook passengers if everyone shows up for the flight.
Travelled SW for the first time because my son gave me and my husband SW giftcards so we booked a trip to Vegas.
Every time we've used another airline (because someone else was booking the flights or Southwest flights for the times we needed were full) we've regretted it.
A meal for the 3.5 hour flight would have been more substantial.
Of course food and beverages you pay for but have no issue with that.
I would advise that you fill up on food before you fly as there is no meal service just peanuts pretzels and mini Ritz sandwich crackers.
There was more than enough time to quickly grab food at the fast food venues next door.
We were then told at the MDW Southwest desk that there was no flight to Philadelphia for another 3 days but that Southwest was not offering us any overnight lodging or meal vouchers.
BUF and MDW do not have the best options for food but you can always find something ok. Don't count on much for breakfast at MSP if flying out early.
We were stuck on the plane from 9am - 7pm PST with no food.
They never gave us meal vouchers or paid for a hotel.
Just remember to buy a meal before you get on a long flight and if you don't mind a long flight on a small plane then Southwest is the way to go.
When we exited the plane only one staff member was anywhere near the door but she was not greeting passengers she was cleaning up the food area.
Southwest avoids punishing customers with extra fees such as change cancellation or bag check fees where possible.
Upon trying to return home from Las Vegas my flight was canceled because of equipment problems.
The 7am flight from LAX to SFO was cancelled for maintenance issues.

We had an issue with our tickets and time our flight was to leave Indy Southwest had cancelled our original flight but had not notified us that our flight was leaving at 6.45 vs 8.10 therefore we missed our flight.
It wasn't until Chicago that they told us that our leg to San Francisco was canceled and the plane was now traveling to Los Angeles.
They also don't charge to change or cancel flights.
We were told at the airport that we had been notified at 11.45 that our flight was cancelled.

The notification about cancelled flight came in too late that could offer only flight to East coast to Dulles in Washington DC and that's your problem how you get to your destination (NY greater area).
Horrible experience we sat in the plane for an hour only to realize that the flight was cancelled because a small plastic emergency sign would not illuminate!
On the return leg they scheduled a Boeing 737-900 (bright and with lots of overhead cabin space) to accommodate the additional load due to storm cancellation the day before.
Their plane made it to the runway and now is receiving maintenance while passengers remain on the plane with no a/c.
Flight from Seattle to San Jose - flight 923 - landed on time
column4: but the connecting flight to Ontario - flight 4032 - scheduled to leave at 8.30pm was going to be delayed to an unknown time
column5: as the lady behind the counter was telling us that the plane encountered mechanical problems but would post the exact departure time as soon as the plane was airborne.

The next morning I went on Southwest.com and went to see if my points had posted I found out they didn't so I called Southwest and they told me that I didn't receive my points because I missed my original flight.
This was my very first flight on Southwest and hopefully my last as they kept on delaying the flight to avoid paying for hotel rooms for passengers who were late coming from a connecting flight.

They are aggressive and used tactics trying to make me feel I was inadequate in my booking purchase.
